from .linkjobparsers import LinkJob
from .gaussianclasses import GaussianOutFile, InternalJob

[docs]class GOF_info(GaussianOutFile):
    """ Gaussian 09 .out file parent class, if any special type of calculation
    requires different processing it should be a subclass of this one """
    def __init__(self,File,ParseList=None):
        self.InternalJobs=[InternalJob()]
        self._File=File
        if ParseList is None:
            ParseList = []
        self._SetParsers(ParseList)
        self._BlockFetcher = self.BlockFetcher()
        _ = next(self._BlockFetcher)
        self._BlockHandler=self.BlockHandler()
        _ = next(self._BlockHandler)
    def __repr__(self):
        cls=type(self).__name__
        File=self._File.name.split("/")[-1]
        Size = len(self)
        return '<{cls}({File})> with {Size} InternalJobs'.format(cls=cls,File=File,Size=Size)
    def __str__(self):
        cls=type(self).__name__
        FileName=self._File.name.split("/")[-1]
        Repr = '<{cls}({File})>\n'.format(cls=cls,File=FileName)
        for InternalJob in self:
            Repr += ' '*4+'{} type <{}>\n'.format(InternalJob,InternalJob.Type)
            for Link in InternalJob:
                 Repr += ' '*8+'{}\n'.format(Link)
        return Repr
    def __len__(self):
        return len(self.InternalJobs)
    def __getitem__(self,index):
        return self.InternalJobs[index]

    def _SetParsers(self,ParseList):
        Register = LinkJob.Register
        Parsers={"Ignore":EmptyLinkJob.parse,
                "General":GeneralLinkJob.parse}
        for key in ParseList:
            if key in Register:
                Parsers[key] = Register[key].parse
            else:
                Parsers[key] = Parsers["General"]
        if 1 not in Parsers:
            Parsers[1] = EmptyLink1.parse
        self._Parsers=Parsers

[docs]    def FileStructure(self):
        """ Display the structure of links and internal jobs of the file """
        Spacer = "  "
        Result = "{!r}\n".format(self)
        for intjob in self:
            Result += Spacer*1+"{!r}\n".format(intjob)
            for link in intjob:
                Result += Spacer*2+"{!r}\n".format(link)
        print(Result)


[docs]    def update(self,Clean = True,EndPrint=False):
        """ Try to fetch new content in the File, if the new content exists
        try to update the last added InternalJob, if it was already finished
        and a new InternalJob has started, it creates it and adds it.

        If Clean is set to True it will automatically remove any
        emtpy LinkJob  """

        BlockFetcher = self._BlockFetcher
        BlockHandler = self._BlockHandler
        BlockType, Block = next(BlockFetcher)
        while BlockType != -9999:
            BlockHandler.send((BlockType, Block))
            BlockType, Block = next(BlockFetcher)
        if self.InternalJobs[0].Number is None:
            self.InternalJobs[0].GuessInfo()
        if Clean:
            self.clean()
        if EndPrint:
            print("{} UPDATED".format(self.__repr__()))


[docs]    def clean(self):
        """ Removes per each InternalJob stored all the EmptyLinkJobs """
        for InternalJob in self.InternalJobs:
            InternalJob.clean()

    # Generators and Coroutines for File Parsing

[docs]    def Reader(self,File):
        """ Generator for line by line reading without stopiteration """
        while True:
            Pos_old = File.tell()
            line = File.readline()
            Pos_new = File.tell()
            ReachedEOF = Pos_old == Pos_new
            yield ReachedEOF,line


[docs]    def BlockFetcher(self):
        """
        Generator that yields the text sliced in blocks and their type.

        A block is an iterable of strings and its type refers to how it
        should be parsed, ranges from Link 1 block, to Link 9999 (1,9999),
        something in betweem Link Blocks (-1) or no End was found (-9999)
        """
        StartKeyws=["(Enter","Entering Link"]
        EndKeyws=["Leave Link"]
        ErrorKeyw="Error termination"
        TerminationKeyw="Normal termination"
        Reader=self.Reader(self._File)
        BlockTypes={str(i):i for i in range(1,10000)}
        BlockTypes["InterBlock"]=-1
        BlockTypes["EOF"]=-9999
        BlockTypes[ErrorKeyw] = 9999
        BlockTypes[TerminationKeyw] = 9999
        yield 'Initialization done'
        # If more than 1 EndKeyws then BlockType Assesment has to be modified
        while True:
            Start=False
            End=False
            Block=[]
            BlockType=BlockTypes["InterBlock"]
            # Read lines before a block start line
            while not Start:
                ReachedEOF,line = next(Reader)
                if ReachedEOF:
                    yield BlockTypes["EOF"], []
                else:
                    Start = any([Keyw in line for Keyw in StartKeyws])
                    if not Start:
                        Block.append(line)
            # When found yield it as a "InterBlock" and prepare Block
            if Block:
                yield BlockType, Block
                Block=[line]
            else:
                Block.append(line)
            # If modifications in EndKeyws, Here the Assesment can be done
            while not End:
                ReachedEOF,line = next(Reader)
                if ReachedEOF:
                    Target = Block[-10:]+[line]
                    if any([ErrorKeyw in item for item in Target]):
                        Block.append(line)
                        keyw = str(BlockTypes[TerminationKeyw])
                        line = ' '.join([keyw]*3)
                        break
                    elif any([TerminationKeyw in item for item in Target]):
                        Block.append(line)
                        keyw = str(BlockTypes[TerminationKeyw])
                        line = ' '.join([keyw]*3)
                        break
                    else:
                        yield BlockTypes["EOF"], []
                else:
                    End = any([Keyw in line for Keyw in EndKeyws])
                Block.append(line)
            # when found End, asses type and yield the block
            Type = line.strip().split()[2]
            BlockType = BlockTypes[Type]
            yield BlockType, Block


[docs]    def BlockHandler(self):
        """ Coroutine. Receives a block, chooses the parser and parses it """
        # Initialization
        Parsers = self._Parsers
        CurrentJob=self.InternalJobs[-1]
        BlockType, Block = yield 'Initialization done'
        while True:
            if BlockType in Parsers:
                Parser = Parsers[BlockType]
            else:
                Parser = Parsers["Ignore"]
            Link =  Parser(Block)
            if Link.Number == 1:
                ChangeInternalJob = Link.InternalJobInfo.ChangeInternalJob
            else:
                ChangeInternalJob = False
            if ChangeInternalJob:
                New=InternalJob()
                self.InternalJobs.append(New)
                CurrentJob = self.InternalJobs[-1]
                CurrentJob.append(Link)
                CurrentJob.GuessInfo()
            else:
                CurrentJob.append(Link)
            BlockType, Block = yield


[docs]class IJ_info(InternalJob):
    """ Gaussian 09 InternalJob parent class, if any special type of Job
    requires different parsing it should be a subclass of this one """

    def __init__(self,Number=None):
        self.Number = Number
        self.Type = None
        self.Links = []
    def __repr__(self):
        cls=type(self).__name__
        if self.Number is None:
            return '<{cls} Created but Empty>'.format(cls=cls)
        else:
            return '<{cls} {Number}>'.format(cls=cls,Number=self.Number)
    def __str__(self):
        return 'Internal Job {}: {}'.format(self.Number,self.Type)
    def __getitem__(self,index):
        return self.Links[index]
    def __len__(self):
        return len(self.Links)


[docs]    def append(self,Link):
        # Restrict to Link objects
        if not isinstance(Link, LinkJob):
            raise TypeError('{r} is not of class {r}'.format(Link,LinkJob))
        self.Links.append(Link)


[docs]    def GuessInfo(self):
        if self.Links:
            Links=(Link for Link in self.Links if Link.Number == 1)
            try:
                StarterLink=next(Links)
                Info=StarterLink.InternalJobInfo
            except AttributeError:
                pass
            except StopIteration:
                pass
            else:
                self.Number = Info.Number
                self.Type = Info.Type


[docs]    def clean(self):
        """ Removes all the Empty Link instances within Links """
        RemoveIndex=[]
        for i,Link in enumerate(self.Links):
            if not Link.Text:
                RemoveIndex.append(i)
        for index in reversed(RemoveIndex):
            _ = self.Links.pop(index)


[docs]    def GetLinks(self,*LinkIds):
        """ Wrapper Method to get a list of Links with certain Ids"""
        return [Link for Link in self.Links if Link.Number in LinkIds]


[docs]class LinkJob_info(LinkJob):
    """ LinkJob Base class, should be an ABC """
    Register={}
    """ Register is a dict where key corresponds to an int, and value
    corresponds to the class """
    def __init__(self,Text,Num=None):
        self.Number=Num
        self.Text=Text
    def __repr__(self):
        cls = type(self).__name__
        msg = '<Link {Number} of class {cls}>'
        return msg.format(cls=cls,Number=self.Number)
    def __str__(self):
        return ''.join(self.Text)

    #@classmethod
    #def parse(cls,Text):
    #    """ This function should return a Link object of the same class that
    #    calls the parse method that has all the attributes typical of them
    #    Requires implementation in the subclass """
